intro: Radiogrammitis subnervosa, commonly known as the slender moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, grass-like appearance and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a thin, wiry stem with closely spaced, small leaves that are often curved. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short, erect stalks at the tips of the stems. Radiogrammitis subnervosa is well adapted to grow on rock surfaces and in soil, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
